roleset.name: attempt

example.name: predicative arg1
example.text: Newsweek is trying to keep pace with rival Time magazine.
example.arg: to keep pace with rival Time magazine

example.name: serial verb, almost
example.text: But the effort is also being made [*] to try and cause jurors not to decide things rationally.
example.arg: cause jurors not to decide things rationally

roleset.note: TRY-V NOTES: VN, FN updated by Julia. (from try.01-v)

roleset.name: lawsuit

example.name: misparsed passive
example.text: The case wasn't tried in court.

example.name: Arg 3 as ' on trial over' rather than 'on trial for'
example.text: Mr. Stanley is on trial over charges that he violated aproclamation , issued by the South African administrator generalearlier this year , which made it a crime punishable by two yearsin prison for any person to `` insult , disparate or belittle ''the election commission .
example.arg: over charges that he violated a proclamation , issued by the South African administrator general earlier this year , which made it a crime punishable by two years in prison for any person to `` insult , disparate or belittle '' the election commission

example.name: Example with arg 1
example.text: The judge scheduled to preside over his trial

example.name: Another arg 1 example
example.text: another defense attorney in Saddam Hussein's trial

example.name: Args 0, 1, and 3.
example.text: Wennerstrom's trial for libel against Mikael Blomkvist

example.name: Slightly different use of arg 1
example.text: a fair celebrity trial in California

roleset.note:
TRY-V NOTES: (from try.02-v)
TRIAL-N NOTES: Roleset based on try.01. No corresponding VN class. Framed by Katie (from trial.02-n)

roleset.name: various idtioms: try one's hand at, try one's patience, etc.

example.name: go on, give it a shot
example.text: As previously reported, the account is troubled, with Philip Morris asking Backer Spielvogel Bates, Ogilvy& Mather, and possibly others to try their hand at developing new creative work.
example.arg: Backer Spielvogel Bates, Ogilvy& Mather, and possibly others

example.name: gimme a break
example.text: She haggled forever over a backpack, and was really trying my patience.

roleset.note: TRY-V NOTES: Frame edited by Arrick (from try.04-v)

example.name: tryouts
example.text: The nagging memory of one afternoon fourteen years ago drove [Jim Gideon, a lean 36-year-old righthander]-1 to take a four-month leave from selling insurance in Texas [*-1] to try out for Mr. Weaver's team.

roleset.name: test the potential of something, taste/wear for the first time

example.text: I have just bought five pairs of work animals; I must go and try them out.

roleset.note: TRY_OUT-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in New Testament. No Corresponding VN class. (from try.05-v)

roleset.name: medical trial, consumer trial, or similar

example.text: We will trial her on continuous face mask oxygen.

example.name: Another example with both args
example.text: a trial of its computers to consumers who qualify for its credit cards or leases .
example.arg: to consumers who qualify for its credit cards or leases

example.name: arg0 and arg2
example.text: the company 's clinical trials of both its animal and human-based insulins
example.arg: of both its animal and human-based insulins

roleset.note:
TRIAL-V NOTES: Based on medical data. Slight comparison to try.01 and trial.01-n. No VN class. Framed by Katie. (from trial.01-v)
TRIAL-N NOTES: Roleset based on try.01. No corresponding VN class. Framed by Katie. (from trial.01-n)
TRIAL-N NOTES: Added by Julia for unification with trial-v.01. (from trial.03-n)
